item.title: Report E-2024110525
item.description:
Report E-2024110525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0509 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UAD. It was reported that approximately 1-quart of BERRY FLAVOR, NATURAL WONF released from a plastic drum due to unknown reasons. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO placed the spilled product and Oil-Dri inside of a steel recovery drum and will patch up the original drum and stage for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110938
item.description:
Report X-2024110938

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-26T12:24:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Single Packaging, One UN 1A1 Plastic Jerrican @ 10 Liters was damaged/punctured on the bottom. Contents: Dynalene EG 50%, Per the SDS found on the manufacturer's website: UN 3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, NOS (Ethylene Glycol), PG III. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024110901
item.description:
Report X-2024110901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking when it was inadvertently placed on its side. The outer box did not have any markings or labels, but the inner box revealed a concealed UN 4G Box of UN 3265, Class 8, PGIII. Inner contents of the UN4G box are 2 plastic bottles @ 2.5 gallons each. 1 bottle was leaking from the cap/top. The labels on the plastic bottles are Ethephon Plant Growth Regulator. The UN4G box was surrounded by empty boxes used as dunnage. The boxes with the Lithium Battery Labels are empty. All of the contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024110465
item.description:
Report E-2024110465

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 15, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of product had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum. GES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and neutralizing agents to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110900
item.description:
Report X-2024110900

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-02
  • City: CARLSBAD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered damaged during sort operation. Outer Packaging: Styrofoam Box. Inner contents: Dry Ice with Gibco Antibiotics (100 ml, 15240-062). The Styrofoam box was broken allowing the Dry Ice to escape onto the floor. There was no damage to the antibiotics. The package was held for shipper disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024110468
item.description:
Report E-2024110468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-25
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1242ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal UOA. It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Eco Lab Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid released from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to improper loading (terminal USB responsible). The release impacted the trailer floor and box it was shipped in. Terminal personnel already put kitty litter around it and cleared the trailer due to strong odor. Due to product being a corrosive Class 8 and strong smell, ERTS advised a contractor should perform cleanup. Service Center Manager, Lee Jackson, approved terminal personnel to clean the release themselves. Waste was put in (1) 20-gallon poly drum with cardboard, spent oil dri and PPE>

item.title: Report X-2024110757
item.description:
Report X-2024110757

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Yard personnel reported container EMHU 261413 (loaded with 26 pallets of Printing ink) was leaking a white liquid. Contractor responded and found 2x 55-gallon drums of printing ink punctured releasing an estimated 10 gallons of printing ink. Contractor overpacked damaged drums and cleaned all impacted areas and secured the container.

item.title: Report X-2024110526
item.description:
Report X-2024110526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 350000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UTLX 130094, loaded HCL tank car, was reported by the LA City FD to be releasing at an uncontrolled rate from the bottom shell of the car in the 4th St yard in Los Angeles. UPRR Hazmat manager made entry with Los Angeles Fire to apply a mag patch kit. During entry we found a hole in the bottom shell of tank car UTLX 130094 that was caused by a rubber line failure causing HCL to release from the shell of the tank car. A mag seal patch was applied to stop the release.
